ppe_requirements.respiratory: NIOSH-approved organic vapor respirator for <50 ppm. SCBA for >50 ppm or unknown concentrations.
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile or butyl rubber gloves. Chemical-resistant clothing. Styrene absorbs through skin.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles, face shield for splash hazard.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for <50 ppm, Level B for >50 ppm
ppe_requirements.special_notes: Neurotoxin and probable carcinogen (IARC 2B). Skin absorption significant. Extremely irritating. May cause CNS depression.

physical_properties.odor: Sweet, floral odor @ 0.05-0.5 ppm (odor fatigue occurs)

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Flammable liquid. May polymerize explosively in fire. Vapors heavier than air. May travel to ignition sources.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Stop flow if safe. Use dry chemical, CO2, alcohol-resistant foam. Water spray to cool containers. Do not use water jet on liquid. Prevent contamination - polymerization hazard.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Eliminate ignition sources. Ventilate area. Contain with sand or earth. Neutralize with sodium bisulfite. Dispose as hazardous waste. Check stabilizer level before handling.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air immediately. Eyes: flush with water for 15 minutes. Remove contaminated clothing - styrene penetrates. Wash skin thoroughly. Seek medical attention - neurotoxin and carcinogen exposure. Monitor for CNS effects.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life. Bioaccumulates. Report spills >1000 lbs.
emergency_response.special_hazards: PROBABLE HUMAN CARCINOGEN (IARC 2B). NEUROTOXIN - causes CNS depression, peripheral neuropathy. Irritating to eyes, skin, respiratory tract. May polymerize explosively. Olfactory fatigue - cannot rely on odor. Metabolized to styrene oxide (more toxic).

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store below 32°C. Keep cool. Avoid excessive heat.
storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation. Mechanical ventilation with emergency backup.
storage_requirements.container_material: Stainless steel or aluminum. Must contain inhibitor (tert-butylcatechol). Check inhibitor level regularly.
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from oxidizers by 20 feet. Flammable liquid storage cabinet.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Minimize quantities. Follow NFPA 30 for flammable liquids.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: CRITICAL: Store with polymerization inhibitor (10-15 ppm tert-butylcatechol). Monitor inhibitor level monthly. Avoid light and heat. Post "FLAMMABLE" and "CANCER HAZARD" signs. Date containers.

reactivity.stability: UNSTABLE. Polymerizes when heated or contaminated. Inhibitor required.
reactivity.polymerization: Exothermic polymerization with peroxides, oxidizers, or heat. May be explosive. Check inhibitor level.
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: May polymerize violently. Reacts with oxidizers. Attacks some plastics, rubber, and coatings. Forms peroxides on prolonged storage.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Toxic to aquatic life. LC50 (fish, 96h): 4-10 mg/L.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Moderate bioaccumulation potential. BCF: 25-150. Log Kow: 2.95.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: Moderate mobility. Adsorbs to soil organic matter. Volatilizes from soil.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Photolyzes via hydroxyl radicals. Atmospheric half-life: 1-2 days. Forms ozone.

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: 0.05-0.5 ppm - WARNING: Olfactory fatigue occurs. Cannot rely on odor for protection.
